messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
I don't really know where I'm at. But one of my customers just got robbed and he got shot.
Okay. Find out where you are, hon.
Yeah, I'm on 62. It's Morris Avenue, or Morris Street.
Are you in Giff County?
I'm right here off 62 at Crossroads. You know where the mobile gas station is?
Okay. I see Morris and East Fairfield. Hold on, sweetie, okay? Hold on.
Please hurry up, he just got shot. Please hurry up.
Hold on for me, okay. What's your phone number you're calling from?
Okay.
They both got guns and they're chasing me.
I need EMS. He just got shot in the chest.
Okay. Please hurry up.
Hold on. What's your cell phone number in case we get disconnected? What's your name, hon?
Please hurry up. They call me.
Do you know why they're chasing you, hon?
Well, he's got a bunch of nice cars in the driveway, and they just walked up and pulled a gun and said that they want the money.
Okay.
And Van told him, he said, I don't have no money. They said, you think I'm playing around? I'm not. And they just shot him.
Listen to me, sweetie. What business is this at?
It's not a business. It's the second house on the right when you pull on Morris.
Oh, Morris? Okay.
Yes, ma'am.
All right. What are they wearing, hon?
Black pants and gray hoodies.
Okay. Please hurry. I'm going to keep you on the line until they get there, okay.
Please hurry up. They're coming to them. They're coming.
They're coming as fast as they can, okay.
Oh, my God. You said they're wearing black pants and gray sweatshirts?
Yes, ma'am. Listen to me, sweetie, okay. You're doing good, all right?
Oh, my God. I can't believe this. It's broad daylight. They just came up and shot him.
Tell the cops I'm back here in the woods hiding. I've got a green shirt.
Okay. I need you to stay on the phone with me until they get there, and I'm letting them know. I'm updating them as you talk to me, okay?
I'm in the woods. I've got a green shirt and tan pants on.
Okay, tell them not to shoot me. Where was your friend when he was shot? Where exactly was he at the house?
On the back porch. We were just sitting out there talking. These two black males walked up and pulled guns.
Okay.
They asked, where's the money? Van said, I ain't got no money on me.
Okay. What happened next?
They shot him. I don't want to go check on Van, but I'm scared.
No, I need you to stay where you are. Your friend's name is Van Yates?
Yes, ma'am. I don't hear any cops. Where are they?
They're on the way. You just remain calm, okay?
I hope he's not dead. Oh, my God.
How old is your friend?
He's probably in his mid-50s.
And he was shot right in the chest?
Yes, point blank.
Do you see if he's awake?
I don't know.
Okay, that's fine. But they shot him right in the chest?
Yes. Van has guns in the house. He went to get money, but they shot him when he opened the screen door.
Okay. Please hurry up. Is there a vehicle in the driveway?
There’s a white Chevrolet. My truck is sitting outside.
Is that Van's vehicle in the driveway?
Yes, ma'am. I don't know if those guys pulled up or walked.
I'll let you know when you can come out. In the meantime, stay where you are, okay?
Oh, my God. I'm like a sitting duck here with this green shirt on. Please hurry up. Van might be dead.
I know, hon. Why did this have to happen?
Van is one of the best people in the world. And they just shot him.
Why were they trying to rob him?
I guess because he has nice cars in the driveway. I don't know. Please hurry up.
I understand. I need you to stay put. Where are the cops?
I hear sirens.
Don't go out until I tell you. Stay put. Are you behind the barn?
Yes, I'm behind the barn.
Okay. I'll let them know. Hold tight.
Why is it taking so long? He's going to be dead.
You stay there until I tell you to come out, okay?
Have they got the ambulance coming?
Yes, we have the ambulance, police, and fire on the way.
Oh, my gosh. I hope he doesn't die.
Right now, we're trying to find out where the suspects are. It won't do any good if they shoot my people.
I understand, ma'am.
Did you see if they left or what?
Whenever they shot Van, I just took off running.
Which I understand, but I can't send in my rescue people until we know where they are. I don't want my people shot either.
I've seen the Archdale Police Department coming down the road.
Okay. Stay put until I tell you to come out.
You are doing good. I was going to get shot.
You did the right thing. If you got hurt, we wouldn't have known.
Yes, ma'am. I hear the Sheriff's Department now.
Just let me know when they come out.
I'll let you know, okay? Stay put.
Man, I hope Van's not dead. Golly.
Where were those guys?
I don't know. We were on the porch, and they just walked up. I didn’t hear a car.
I just ran. I still can't believe they shot Van. Is the ambulance there yet?
I'm not sending the ambulance in until we find the suspects.
Are they close by?
Yes, they're close. Just stay tight until I tell you to come out.
I can't believe this. Have they found Van yet?
I don't know, hon. I have a bunch of police units coming, including Archdale and the Sheriff's Department.
Is that all right?
We're managing the situation, hon.
My God. When can they come in?
Our sheriff's department is there, and they're telling the EMS people to come on in. Hold on, and I'll let you know when you can come out, okay?
All right.
Do you have anything on you?
No, no weapons. I'll come out with my hands up. I'm behind the barn.
Hold on. Just stay, okay? Let them get your friend situated and figure out where the suspects are. Then they'll tell you to come out.
I hear the ambulance.
They're there along with the fire department and the sheriff's department, but they need to get some things straightened out first.
I don't know. Oh, my God.
I know, hon. Just hold on.
